name: Courtyard by Marriott New York Manhattan / Times Square South

reviews.title: Loved It!!!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel - based on the good reviews from this website - and I just had to write to tell everyone that we couldn't have picked a better hotel for our first visit to NYC! The hotel was wonderful and the location was so perfect ! If you want to be close to Times Square, the theatre district and the Empire State Building (all two blocks away), this hotel is for you. Plus if you plan to explore the city like we did, it is within walking distance of so many attractions and is only 2 blocks from the subway for the things that you can't walk to. Speaking of subway, we took the subway from JFK ( sooo easy) to the 42nd St station - came up the stairs and just walked two blocks east and there was our hotel. We checked in, went to our room, and held our breath as we opened the curtains - there it was, the view of the Empire State Building as I had requested on my reservation! We both did the happy dance! It was especially neat at night when it would light up in red, white and blue lights in honor of Presidents Day. So when you submit your reservation, make sure and request a view of the ESB! The room was really nice, especially the bed! It felt like we were sleeping on a cloud - with an amazing featherbed and fluffy down comforter. It was great after a full day of sightseeing. The staff were so nice and helpful - they were happy to give us directions and and gave us great recommendations for restaurants and bars. P.S There is a great Irish pub right next to the hotel :-) We would also recommend taking the Grays Line Double Decker bus tour (catch them at Times Square) which was a great way to see all the attractions and sites in Manhattan because you can get off and back on as much as you like. Make sure you get a seat on the top if it's not too cold! The room was a lot more than we normally spend on a hotel but it was worth every penny for the nice, clean room in fabulous location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great hotel for my first time actually staying in New York. The location could not be better, we where right in Times Square. Everything was in walking distance and the subway was at the end of the block. This is a perfect place to stay if you don't want to hear the ambulances or police sirens going off because you are slightly off of the main street but only by a few steps. The concierge in the lobby was great for site seeing info. We didn't get a chance to do the bus tours, but we did our own site seeing via the subway which was not bad at all once you learned which way to enter for the subway trains. The rooms were nice, we stayed on the 2nd floor ,and of course we didn't have much of a view, but that was ok. The room was more than adequate and clean. The bathroom was a nice size and very clean as well. On check out, we asked for a late check out, but of course because there we so many people before us asking for late check out, all they could do for us was 1pm but they stored our luggage in the hotel at no additional fee as we continued to explore New York further. Will deifinetly visit again.
reviews.title: A Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have just returned today from a 4 night stay at the hotel for valentines weekend. We booked the hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor, which has become our reliable holidaying guide. The hotel: LOCATION - 500 yards from times square, 6 blocks from Macy's and empire, 1 1/2 blocks from 5th ave, subway on corner, Bryant park (which is lovely) 1 block away, overall an excellent location. Also stayed on high floor so absolutely no noise. ROOM - Not the most modern but accaptable, after all we didnt go from Scotland all the way to New York for the room. STAFF - Extremely happy and helpful throughout the entire stay. WOULD WE STAY THERE AGAIN - Absolutely, If you are on a budget and want a value hotel then this is the one. If you expect luxury then this is not for you.
reviews.title: valentines weekend

reviews.text: Overall new york was wonderful. Breakfast at the Red flame diner on 42nd and 6th, is FAB. O'lunneys Irish bar on 43rd and 7th was great for both drink and food. We tipped the barman $2 every time we bought a drink and every 3rd drink we would get 1 on the house. Woodbury common (a 1hr bus ride from port authority) for bargains is unbelievable, especially if you're British because of the dollar. A horse and cart ride for $34 in central park is also wonderful.
reviews.title: Convenient, great location
good room and location
reviews.text: The End

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this property for three nights in early April. The location was excellent, near Times Square but far enough off of Times Square to avoid the noise, lights, and bustle while trying to sleep. Subway stations are very close, making it easy to visit areas outside of walking distance.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: We did not use the breakfast room, though it looked and smelled very nice. We opted instead for bagels in Bryant Park, which is very near.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel in a perfect location

likes.liked: — the level of comfort at its location

reviews.text: Service at the hotel was excellent. We arrived near midnight on a Sunday night without our luggage, thanks to a cancelled flight, and the staff was very accommodating. They had a nice supply of free emergency toiletries available that they were quick to dispense. When we checked out, the bellman was prompt to assist us with our bags.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location near Times Square

likes.liked: — The room was nice and the location was awesome
likes.disliked: — Not getting us a proper room the first night when they sent us to another hotel

reviews.text: The room was clean and roomy and the bed was very comfortable. I would highly recommend this property.
reviews.title: 2nd stay here, just as good as the 1st...

likes.disliked: — Bathroom a little dated even thou shower was new and excellent!

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel my second trip to NYC. Both times I stayed in Times Square but this hotel was top notch! From a spacious room (the first trip well lets just say space was at a premium!) to attentive staff, this hotel had it all. It was located near Bryant Park and the theater I was going to. We spent most of the trip walking or taking taxi's and found this hotel to be the perfect accompaniment to our trip. I would totally recommend this hotel in NYC.
reviews.title: Would recommend!!

reviews.text: I traveled with a group of 8 women and we stayed in two rooms. We could not have been more pleased. We were on the 26th floor and one of the rooms had an Empire State Bldg view. The rooms were quiet, the beds were incredible, and the rooms were very clean. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Will definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.text: From reading reviews on TripAdvisor I had high expectations of the Courtyard and I wasn't disappointed. From the moment we checked in until we returned to collect our luggage on the last day we couldn't have asked for more. We arrived slightly earlier than the stated 3:00 check-in but there was no problem with us checking in. The clerk on reception was exceptionally helpful and also provided us with complimentary tote bags which came in very handy for the journey home.
reviews.title: Perfection !
Great location and clean!
reviews.text: The whole hotel is smoke-free with hefty fines for anyone caught smoking in a room. Rooms are spacious and very clean with good storage (wardrobes/drawers) and also a safe. The bathroom is also excellent with a wonderful rain drop shower head and more than enough towels.
The beds (twin queen sized in our room, as requested) were the most comfortable I have ever slept in and the hotel is very quiet with hardly any traffic noise audible from outside.
reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect

likes.disliked: — There was only one chair provided in the room but there were two occupants

reviews.title: Friendly reception
reviews.text: Location-wise it is ideal - very close to Times Square and a number of the key attractions with a good number of taxis passing the front door both during the day and in the evening if your feet are tired from pounding the pavements.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel MLK weekend. The location was perfect for us. We went on the grayline tours, which picked up a few blocks away in Times Square. Very convenient location. Subway was half a block away. Walked uptown and downtown very easily. Liberty Airport shuttle very convenient, a couple of block away at Bryant Park. Not to mention the price was nice, $179 a night.
reviews.title: Great Location!!!

likes.liked: — Location, cleanliness, free tea and coffee in lobby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was clean and comfortable. NIce sized room with nice sized closet. The front desk personnel was always friendly. Internet access available in lobby, which allowed us to checkin and print out our boarding passes.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

reviews.text: I would definatley stay here again and recommend to others.
reviews.title: Excellent Value

likes.disliked: — Room A Little Small But Good For New York!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Given that it was around New Years and Hotels were generally expensive my wife and I were extremely happy the location and facilities this Hotel provides.
reviews.title: Good Hotel but slow elevators and limited views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is approximately 5 minutes walk to both Times Square and Herald Square (Macys) which is ideal for those who are concerned with Shopping.
reviews.title: Great location for a good price

reviews.text: I traveled to New York for business and chose this hotel because of a package on the website that included an Explorer pass, which gave free admission to various attractions in the city. My colleague and I felt this would be a great way to see some sites while we were in town.
reviews.title: Great location, comfortable rooms, good overall

reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location - it was a 25 minute cab ride from LGA, and is smack in the middle of Midtown, right at the edge of Times Square. Very convenient to walk to mostly anything in Midtown (Times Square, Theater District, Rockefeller Center, NY Library, Herald Square, etc). There's also Subway stops at both ends of the street.
reviews.title: convenient and spacious room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything is very clean; the rooms were a good size for NY. My colleague had a nice view of the Empire State Building from her room on the 29th floor. The staff was very friendly in all interactions. We didn't eat the breakfast in the hotel (why would you in NY?), but did utilize the coffee in the lobby and the market as well.
reviews.title: Great for the price.

reviews.text: My only complaint really has to deal with the package we booked. We chose this hotel over others in the area simply because the package included the Explorer pass. We were told upon check-in that they'd call up to our rooms about the pass, but the call never came. The next morning, we asked and were then informed that they were out of the passes, so we'd just need to bring receipts of any applicable attractions and they'd reimburse us. It was a disappointing resolution, especially since we chose the hotel because of that package, and we never ended up doing any of those attractions because we didn't feel like it was worth the trouble. This didn't affect the comfort or our satisfaction of the hotel, but was the only negative experience we had.
reviews.title: Great room, excellently situated for exploring Manhattan

reviews.text: Stayed in other hotels in NYC, and had expectations of tiny room size in all hotels in NYC, unless staying in some top five stars ones. Marriott Courtyard is comparatively very spacious in NYC, and it is very surprising and amazing. The location is unbeatable. Times Square is just few blocks away. Delis all around. Amazing service is the ultimate reason causes me returning again in future.
reviews.title: Rude stuck up employees

reviews.text: This hotel was oversold my first night. I arrived around midnight to find that they didn't have a room for me. They gave me $20 for cab fare and sent me to the Courtyard at 53rd and 3rd for the night. That hotel gave me a room, no questions asked, without even asking for my credit card. (An aside: that Courtyard was very nice; if I need to be on that side of town, I'll definitely consider that hotel.)
reviews.title: Excellent location, excellent hotel

likes.disliked: — cell phone reception inside the hotel is terrible

reviews.text: I returned to the Courtyard Times Square South the following day and got a room. They apologized again, and gave me a voucher for free breakfast the next day, as well as some bonus Marriott points for the inconvenience.
reviews.title: Great hotel next to wonderful Bryant Park

likes.liked: — Good quality, great location, fair price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was large, with a LCD TV, comfortable bed, excellent linens, and free internet. The room (and entire hotel) looked completely refurbished, and the hotel is spotless. I was in the back corner of the hotel, so I didn't have much of a view, but it was very quiet - I never heard noise from the street.
reviews.title: Can't go Wrong

reviews.text: The location is excellent - between 6th and Broadway on 40th Street. Bryant Park is half a block away, and Times Square and Rockefeller Center are close by.
reviews.title: Good Location Good service
Great Location
reviews.text: I got one of the best night's sleep I've had on the road the first night I stayed in this hotel. I'll be back.

I took my daughter for the weekend to see a Broadway show for her sweet 16th birthday. I've stayed in NYC before so I was ready for the tiny room...was I surprised! Room was very large by NY standards. Location was amazing, we were able to shop and drop stuff off, walk to restaurants, our broadway show, anything you could possibly want. The beds were wonderful! We could see our theater (St James) from our window which just added to the tirp. We had a pre-theater drink in the revolving lounge and even though we just had one drink the waiter made us feel like he perfectly happy to have us. Was it expensive...of course, it's in the heart of Times Square and definitly a quality hotel. If you're looking for that perfect Times Square experience, this really is the place to stay!
reviews.title: For the Perfect Times Square Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great time here as part of our honeymoon. It is ideally placed for Broadway, Macys, Times Square etc, and there is a subway entrance right at the end of the road. Didn't try the breakfasts, as there are loads of very reasonably priced places nearby - one right next door. The street outside the hotel was not always so nice, but you felt quite safe as soon as you got in. The rooms were pretty good size for NY, and it all felt really clean - no sign of bedbugs at all! Free internet access and coffee in the lobby were good, as was the glazing on the windows - we weren't at all disturbed by noise inside. Would definitely use this hotel again.
reviews.title: Fantastic location!!

reviews.text: I came to New York for what was supposed to be a sort business trip. Because of my flights, I planned to be in the hotel (or at my meeting) for about 36 hours. I ended up spending three nights.
reviews.title: Excellent place to be stuck during a snowstorm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were great. Very friendly and helpful with recommendations and directions.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the hotel to be clean and comfortable. The room was quiet (except for some street noise from snowplows) and I could not hear neighbors.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel!!!!!!! Cant wait to go back :)

reviews.text: Asked for an early check in - got it!
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Asked for adjoining rooms with our friends - got it!
reviews.title: A little gem!!

reviews.text: Asked for view of Empire State - got it!
reviews.title: Terrific stay with small children!

reviews.text: We used the valet to park our rental car. When we asked for it to be brought up, hotel staff left it unattended and did not notify us it was there for 15 min. When we got to the car, we were treated to a $115 parking ticket which the hotel has yet to take care of.
reviews.title: Indifferent, Lying Staff Cost Me Big $$$

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also checked our luggage into the bell closet while we did some last minute sight-seeing. My laptop was in a small duffel. When we got our luggage back and I checked my laptop later that day, I discovered the screen was cracked - and cracked to such and extent to suggest that our belongings had been deliberately mishandled.
reviews.title: First rate hotel.

reviews.text: My wife remembered the bellman. When we provided this information, we were assured he was a good employee and he said nothing had happened to our property while it was in their care. Still, the front desk manager, Roman Babekov, told us they would refer the claim to their insurance and gave me a bunch of busywork questions to provide him. When I finally spoke to the adjuster, they told me they were denying the claim.
reviews.title: Great location / Helpful Staff

likes.disliked: — No place to grab a drink after the show - but in NYC there are many places around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite the fact that I have been extremely polite during this whole processs, Babekov et al have now ceased all contact with me and have not offered me any resolution other than "sorry."
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: BEWARE.
reviews.title: Worth the money!!!

reviews.text: Marriott Courtyard Times Square is conveniently located near Times Square, right nearby lovely Bryant Park. Friendly staff (if a bit over-attentive), well appointed rooms, although there was a constant cold draft going through which was uncomfortable. Free wireless internet was a big plus. An overall nice hotel
reviews.title: Excellent room and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights this week having chosen carefully from the reviews on this site, and it was perfect. I was dreading arriving and being disappointed with the room or noise etc, but it was absolutely ideal. It is justifiably in the top 10(ish) of most popular hotels.
reviews.title: Perfect

likes.disliked: — Slightly musty smell in the bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel could not be in a better location being minutes from Times Square, Bryant Park, Penn Station, Macy's, Grand Central and the Empire States Building.
reviews.title: Very Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is shoe-horned into a slim space betweeen two office blocks, but is incredibly well-kept and quiet. The staff were extremely polite and welcoming, the concierge was excellent, and the room was lovely. It is true that the bed was the comfiest I have ever known!
reviews.title: Location Location Location !!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can be quite critical, but cannot find a single fault with this hotel. If you are able to afford to pay about $300 per night, definitely stay here.
reviews.title: Great location and service.

reviews.text: I am hoping to return to NY and will certainly be back at this hotel.
reviews.title: Mediocre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on Christmas Eve. We only had a night in New York, and we wanted a good location over all else. The hotel certainly has it - a couple of blocks from Times Square (but a quiet street) and close to everything in Midtown.
reviews.title: Excellent location, pleasant hotel
A Conundrum
reviews.text: Highly recommended.

Well this was my first trip to New York so i wasn't sure what to expect, but this hotel was a lot better then I thought it would be. For starters we asked for a high room with a view of the Empire state building and that's exactly what we got. The room was a good size with 2 double beds which were extremely comfortable and the bed linen was so soft (comment from my wife!). The bathroom had a great power shower and was good enough without being amazing. There was also a tv, an ipod player and a free safe and fridge. It's always good to have a safe!!
reviews.title: perfect stay

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend (June 1-3), with my husband and 7-yr-old daughter. It was a great stay! We took advantage of the complementary breakfast (offered with our Amex rewards points that we used to book the hotel), walked easily to all the surrounding sites (Times Square, Empire State Building -- we could see it from our windows, just as I had requested!), and the staff were prompt and courteous.
reviews.title: Perfect location!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely recommend this!
reviews.title: A Gem in New York City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Courtyard unexpectedly for 1 night, May 24th 2007, when we missed our connecting Delta flight to Rome. We have stayed at many other Manhattan properties, but for the money, this was truly the BEST!!!. Efficient and friendly check in, exceptional rate ($199.00 in NYC at Times Square), clean modern and comfortable rooms. They even allowed a late check out until 2PM so we did not have to hang around the airport more than necessary. Since our bags did not arrive with us, they even gave us a small pack of laundry soap to wash out our essentials. A big thanks to Marriott for helping smooth out the bumps in our trip. We will be back.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there last weekend and it was great. Comfortable room, friendly staff, the coffee and fruit in the lobby was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Good location, subway station on the corner, drug store next door for those things you've forgotten, two blocks from Times Square.
reviews.title: Solid hotel for business trip!
It even won over my adult child who lives in Brooklyn
reviews.text: Just got back from visiting my child. It was a last minute trip and I could not find a place nearby, so booked a room at the Courtyard. It was less than a block from the train. It was quiet. It was clean. The room was relaxing. The staff was superb. It was convenient to everything we wanted to do. My child balked at a place near Times Square, but after 2 nights there, he said it was wonderful and he would definitely stay with me there again. It is now my place to stay in Manhattan.

I stayed with a journalism school group and it was a great location. It was just a few blocks from the Times Square Area, tons of shopping, and a lot of great food. It's of course really expensive, but I wasn't too worried about that at the time, as it was with a school group. I would definitely recommend it if you have the money for it. It was very clean and a great place for a newbie in the city. I was a little nervous about staying in the big city, but I felt totally safe. There was a total creeper hanging outside the hotel, but I felt safe inside. The showers were a little weird because it was completely clear, but I guess that is the "modern" look.
reviews.title: It's a fantastic place to stay

reviews.text: My wife found this hotel after searching online. I am glad she did, as we had the most fabulous experience. Traveled to NYC to see The Strokes and LCD Soundsystem play on back to back nights at MSG. Coincidentally, it was also World Autism Day. Upon check-in, I asked front desk person Frantzy Laurent if there was any way he could accommodate my son and I by upgrading us to a room with a view of the Empire State Building, which was lit blue . Sure enough, with a smile and a nod, Frantzy hooked us up!!! You made our trip that much more special
reviews.title: SIMPLY AMAZING - THIS IS NOW MY GO TO HOTEL IN MANHATTAN
Central, cvomfortable times sq courtyard
reviews.text: About the room; astonishing size and appointments for a mid-priced hotel in NYC. The room was sleek and modern. Bed was luxuriously comfortable. Complimentary water and coffee from a Keurig machine was a great bonus. In addition, the lobby had 24 hour coffee service. Room also had nice ihome clock radio, free wireless Internet, and TWO(!) 42" LG flat screens (one in the bedroom, one in the sitting room). Small fridge in room as well. also the rooms were IMMACULATE!!!
Location: 1/2 a block from N line taking us down to east village, 1/2 a block from Broadway, lower end of Times Square. Unbelievable location. Shops , restaurants, Duane Reade, Walgreens steps away.
reviews.title: Exceed expectations!

reviews.text: We chose this hotel based on price. Comparable hotels were almost double in price, and I can't imagine that I would have been any more pleased at any of them. I do not have one single complaint about Courtyard Times Square. From the time we checked in, until we checked out, from the bell staff to the maintenance workers, we did not pass by one employee that did not acknowledge us with a smile and a "hello, good morning," etc. Our standard room was exceptionally clean and spacious enough for us and our 7 year old. The shower had the extra large "raindrop" head, as well as a handheld head. The buffet breakfast was included in our rate, with something for any type of diet or taste. Again, even the omelette chef was happy and friendly. The location was perfect. Centrally located, an easy walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Neil Simon Theatre, and more. I have never been more pleased with a hotel experience based solely on rooms, location, and staff. The staff is what really made the experience exceptional!
reviews.title: Not one complaint!

likes.liked: — location and above friendly and attentive staff

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: I drained our Marriott Reward acct for a 4 night stay in December 2006 when hotels are reeeeaaaaalllllllllllly pricey in NYC. (I made the reservations 6 months in advance.) The room was not ready til about 4PM (I arrived at 8AM on the red eye). But it was worth the wait--- a spotless, comfortable room with a big cushy bed and a dead-on view of the Empire State Building which was all lighted up in red and green. There was soft Christmas music playing when I walked in!

After a wonderful 4 night stay at the Hilton Garden Inn, we headed over to the Marriott Courtyard TS for a weekend stay using rewards. We were expecting a similar experience here based on all of the reviews. Unfortunately, our stay was OK at best. We're guessing housekeeping just finished cleaning the room as it reeked of air freshener, and a the refridgerator wasn't cleaned out from the previous guests. Our room was more along the lines of a motel - it was tiny, and the furniture was very worn. It definitely needed a facelift. The bathroom door wouldn't stay open, so we had to put a towel down to hold it open, otherwise, the bathroom was really muggy after showers, and the mirror stayed fogged. We had a king bed & a roll away for our son, and it was a really tight fit - two nights was all we could stand of our tiny room. Being a Marriott Rewards Platinum member, we expected a nicer room, however, we did stay on points & made use of the coin laundry facilities, so our main reasons for staying were accomplished.
reviews.title: Not so much
Great Location - Has a fly problem in Room 204
reviews.text: I will say the staff was very friendly, and the hotel is in a great location - we could walk to just about anything in the Times Square area, and the subway was just steps away. The location is what makes this hotel high in the ratings. Personally, I feel there are better choices.

We stayed in this hotel November 15 - 18th. You cannot beat the location and the price for Manhattan. I was traveling with my incredibly spry 83 year old mother. When we checked in - the only room available was the handicapped accessable room - which is just fine with us - and especially in Manhattan where this usually results in a larger room. (Room #204). We checked in the and bathroom had flies. Many flies. My mom felt certain these came up through the sewer drain in the unusual shower set up for a wheelchair. She was probably right. We reported this and asked for the room to be sprayed while we were out to dinner. Still had flies. Next day - reported the fly problem - received a lovely apology and breakfast coupons and a promise to spray - still had flies. Next day - flies. Reported again. Checked out with flies. Simple bleach in the drain would have cured the problem. I am a frequent Marriott "stay-er" and reported this on the web site. No response. Good thing I am a hardy girl from the Midwest and not afraid of bugs.
reviews.title: Good location, Internet problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel, southeast of Times Square, makes it a good choice for the business traveller.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I frequent NYC and have stayed in numerous hotels in all manhattean neighborhoods. This is a great midtown choice. On par with mid-range prices of the city; steps away from numerous subway lines in all directions (1,2,3,A,C,E,N,R,Q), two blocks from Times Square and theatre district, two blocks from Bryant park, NY Public Library and one more block to Grand Central Station (LINES 4,5,6 and Metro North ETC) . Penn Station two blocks south (for Amtrak and LIRR and subway et al). 24 hr Duane Reade drug store on the corner also. In the middle of it all, still very quiet for a midtown location (regarding typical city noises) since it in the middle of a east/west cross streeet. Taxis abound (if you must) at end of block in either direction.
reviews.title: Excellent choice after seeing many

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: New, clean, staff very amicable and helpful. Nice baths, comfy beds, rooms are very new and well cared for. Plenty of storage space, we had huge tiled walk in shower, safe and refer in room with Kerig coffee machine/pods provided. There is a on site restaurant for breakfast if you like. Computer for use, a conceirge desk and a brand new (smallish but very adequate) fitness center. Hint: walk two short blocks west and park your car on your own with online coupons from Central Park and save over 12.00 per night from hotel valet charges.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, great location - avoid using the pre-booked cars!

reviews.text: Impressed...can't go wrong with location, new, comfortable, very clean, friendly and no bed bugs - what more can you ask for in NYC?
reviews.title: Nice hotel just off Times Square

reviews.text: This hotel is great! Fabulous comfy beds, good clean rooms and bathrooms, great quality and variety of breakfast items and the location is hard to beat!
reviews.title: Amazing View!

reviews.text: My only complaint would be that we used the concierge to pre-book a car to take us to a local restaurant. They charged us $45 and the car was old, dirty and not of a good standard. By comparison on the way back we got a yellow cab, which cost us $10 (including a tip) and the cab was far superior in quality!
reviews.title: Location location location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On this trip, however, I had major problems with the Internet. On my first room on the 5th floor, my laptop could see one access point, but couldn't connect. I called the help line, and they reset the router. To check that it wasn't my computer, I went down to the lobby, and connected immediately to the network.
reviews.title: Fantastic - Location, Service - Everything!!

reviews.text: I took my daughter here for her 16th birthday and we had a long weekend. The staff were very professional and polite but could appear a little intimidating at times. We would have appreciated more advice from them on places to go as it was our first time travelling to NY and as 2 females we were nervous. I asked for a rec Italian restaurant and they sent us to a completely over- fussy expensive one, not at all suitable for our laid back style. The room was excellent as it was quiet, very, very clean and the pillows were like marshmallows ! It is really well priced for where it is situated and i would recommend it.
reviews.title: Great for the price: Courtyard New York Manhattan/Times Square South

reviews.text: I booked this hotel based upon the reviews on this site. I have travelled to NYC before, but years ago and this time was special with my husband and step-son (10 yo). It was their first time.
reviews.title: Hotel was a little disappointing

reviews.text: The location is great...right off Broadway near Times Square. The hotel was smaller than I thought. The reception was great, however, the room they assigned us (1202, I think) was very musty and had black mold-like stuff on popcorn ceiling in bathroom. We immediately requested another room and was offered one for the next night. (Plus, they gave us breakfast vouchers for the inconvenience.) The new room (1701) was better, although I wouldn't consider it above a B- in quality. I think the hotel rooms generally need a make-over. They show several years of wear and tear. The common areas appear to be newer than the rooms.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.text: Despite the rooms, I must say that the staff were extremely pleasant and friendly during the whole stay. We enjoyed it in the city and would stay again...but probably at another hotel to try something different.
reviews.title: Pretty Good Place - A Hidden Gem

reviews.text: Family stayed here for long four day weekend and loved it! Great location, nice, big rooms and great staff. No question we would stay here again.
reviews.title: Couldn't have been better!

reviews.text: We chose this hotel for our visit to New York after reading many positive reviews on this site. Our trip took in Thanksgiving last year and was we in the ideal spot to take in the Macy's Thanksgiving Parade we literally walked out the hotel and turned left and slapped bang into the parade route. Just on the corner of Broadway and 42nd we could not be located any better for Times Square and Macy's a stone's throw away, and it was such excellent value. The rooms were clean and more spacious than expected after hearing about New York's legendary small hotel rooms, they had modern decor and flat screen tv not that we spent much time awake in there. All in all a very nice stay so much so that looking to stay again when next vist.
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.disliked: — The Lifts were a bit erratic

reviews.text: Spent one night at this hotel. Was happy with the room on the 27th floor facing 40th St., although there is no view. Room was small but comfortable. Check-in was fast and check-out can be done by voicemail. Free wireless Internet reliable. A personal safe in the room was big enough to hold a notebook computer. There were few inconveniences. There is no ice or vending machine on the floor. You need to go down to the lower lobby level. But once you're there, there is plenty of drinks and snacks. Also, the drain in the bathtub is very noisy.
reviews.title: Good Find

reviews.text: I chose this hotel for business travel based largely on its high ratings from TripAdvisor reviewers, and I wasn't disappointed. Although the hotel is located on a nondescript stretch of W. 40th St., it's within walking distance of every major midtown attraction as well as NYC's major subway lines. Request a high floor and an Empire State Building view for a touch of flair; otherwise, simply enjoy the convenience of being just outside of NYC's hubbub (in contrast to the Marriott Marquis a few blocks north; where you have to fight the Times Square crowds to get to your hotel).
reviews.title: Justifiably popular

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The amenities are impressive. My room came with free wireless internet (better than the free wired connection promised by the hotel website), which was fast and flawless, a *huge* plus. The modestly sized flat-screen TV was a nice touch; more important was the content, all free of charge, on the TV- several dozen stations, including HBO, Showtime, Cinemax and The Movie Channel. Keeping the only ice machines in the basement was an odd quirk, but the free coffee machine in the lobby made up for it. Can't give the hotel credit for this one, but it was great having a falafel cart parked right down the road all night.
reviews.title: Great location, clean room, overall good choice!

aka: Courtyard By Marriott New York Manhattan / Times Square South Hotel
description: Modern hotel in heart of Fashion District - Walk to Theatre District, Times Square, Empire State Building.
